nav.div: Richland County Community Unit School District #1 » News » What's New » RCCU1 Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

div.div: RCCU1 Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year
April 17, 2020 Update - RCCU #1 Announces Closure for the Remainder of 2019-2020 Academic Year

div.p:
On Friday, April 17, 2020, Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker announced that all K-12 schools in Illinois will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. The schools in the Richland County School District will continue with remote learning days through the regularly scheduled end of the 2019-2020 academic year on May 20th. The last day for student work will be on May 19th. A copy of the district's Remote Learning Plan can be found on the district website. Click here to view the Remote Learning Plan.
"These are definitely challenging times for students, families, teachers, and the entire community," stated Chris Simpson, RCCU1 Superintendent of Schools. "While this is not the spring term that any of us expected or wanted, RCCU1 is committed to continue to focus on the following priorities."
* Ensure that all students are receiving a meal if they need one.
* Ensure that there is some system of continuity of education that is reasonable based on the diversity of our student population.
* Ensure that all RCCU1 employees and the entire school community receive timely information and that their needs are being met.
Mr. Simpson further stated, "We appreciate the very hard work of our administrators and teachers in implementing the district's Remote Learning Plan and the challenges being met by students and parents as learning continues at home. It is very important that we continue to work together to make the best of a difficult situation. We are all in this together."
Additional information about how the school year will end and activities such as graduation and promotion will be provided at a later date.
